str2: Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
Egyptian. From Aiguptos; an Eyyptian or inhabitant of Egyptus.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) of persons: powerful, able, (b) of things: possible. From dunamai; powerful or capable; neuter possible.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
